div.div: STUFFED IN THE WORLD'S LARGEST COUCH

div.a: Why Was $114 Billion Withdrawn From U.S. Banks?

div.div: More than $114 billion walked out of the biggest United States banks this month, and nobody’s quite sure why.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WM1Lxb&via=Digg&text=Why Was $114 Billion Withdrawn From U.S. Banks?

div.a: Nature Has A Formula That Tells Us When It's Time To Die

div.div: There is a mathematical formula which says if you tell me how big something is, I can tell you — with some variation, but not a lot — how long it will live.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VQEKLr&via=Digg&text=Nature Has A Formula That Tells Us When It's Time To Die

div.a: 'Dell Dude' Says He Can Fix Dell

div.div: Ben Curtis, the actor made famous by his role in Dell commercials early last decade, says he’s got the solution to the problems that led Michael Dell to seek a leveraged buyout: Resurrect the “Dell Dude.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VXgNSC&via=Digg&text='Dell Dude' Says He Can Fix Dell

div.div: Apple just reported that it made a profit of $13.1 billion on $54.5 billion in revenue last quarter, including the launch of two new products—the iPhone 5 and iPad Mini—and the holiday shopping season. The company sold 47.8 million iPhones, 22.9 million iPads, 4.1 million Macs, and 12.7 million iPods. If all those numbers make your head spin, just look at these charts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wnx7JM&via=Digg&text=Apple's $54.5 Billion Quarter In Charts

div.div: WHAT PREYS ON THE GREAT WHITE?

div.a: What Bit This Great White Shark?

div.div: Scientists discover the one thing that preys on Great White sharks. phenomena.nationalgeographic.c... by @edyong209

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11R6945&via=Digg&text=What Bit This Great White Shark?

div.a: A Lip Reader Breaks Down The Great Umpire-Manager Fights Of 2012

div.div: What are all the infielders saying when they gather on the mound between at-bats? Are they talking tactics, or are they really discussing their dinner plans? What does a hitter say when he turns around to question a call? And what about managers, who have the most animated and extended on-field exchanges? A lip reader lets you know what's really going on during the game.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UkJhWc&via=Digg&text=A Lip Reader Breaks Down The Great Umpire-Manager Fights Of 2012

div.a: This Is Basically Just A Can Of Cancer

div.div: A new medical study poses huge questions for the future of soft drinks.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wf3E7X&via=Digg&text=This Is Basically Just A Can Of Cancer

div.a: The Single Best Piece Of Obama Swag In Existence

div.div: Even the 1% are jealous of this ride.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VMF3qB&via=Digg&text=The Single Best Piece Of Obama Swag In Existence

div.a: Cops Busted For Racing Cars To Donut Shop

div.div: Three policemen in Canada are being investigated for a YouTube video that allegedly shows their squad cars racing Fast & Furious-style into the parking lot of a Calgary Tim Hortons.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10qmqI8&via=Digg&text=Cops Busted For Racing Cars To Donut Shop

div.a: What Beatboxing Looks Like In An MRI Scan

div.div: How does a beatboxer produce such a wide range of percussion sounds?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SBVI0d&via=Digg&text=What Beatboxing Looks Like In An MRI Scan

div.a: A Recent History Of Vogue’s Tone-Deaf Editorials

div.div: Vogue recently published "Storm Troupers," a sincere but incredibly tone-deaf attempt to "celebrate" the unsung heroes of Hurricane Sandy. Sadly, this was not the first time the international beacon of style has momentarily acted without class.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UVTTtF&via=Digg&text=A Recent History Of Vogue’s Tone-Deaf Editorials

div.a: Bag Full Of Otters Recovered At Thai Airport

div.div: Smugglers fell just a bit short in the latest attempt to traffic live animals. They forgot to claim the bag.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WL003h&via=Digg&text=Bag Full Of Otters Recovered At Thai Airport

div.a: Military Ban On Women Serving In Combat Removed

div.div: Senior defense officials say Pentagon chief Leon Panetta is removing the military’s ban on women serving in combat, opening hundreds of thousands of front-line positions and potentially elite commando jobs after more than a decade at war.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10x2HXh&via=Digg&text=Military Ban On Women Serving In Combat Removed

div.a: Bloomberg Releases New Interactive Billionaire List

div.div: Bloomberg has put together a great interactive on the world's billionaires.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WKw6w2&via=Digg&text=Bloomberg Releases New Interactive Billionaire List

div.div: THE BUNNY SLOPE IS THE MOST DANGEROUS
If you've never been skiing before, here's a handy guide to what you'll actually find on each slope.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UhSTkC&via=Digg&text=Honest Ski Level Signs

div.a: The Social Network Where We're All Just A Number

div.div: What if you wanted to go online and post some thoughts or ideas that wouldn’t be associated with your identity? What if you were secretly a cat person (the horror) and wanted to talk about your love of cats, or had a really embarrassing disease you wanted to talk about with other people? Maybe you’d head to the new anonymous social network called Social Number, which is trying to give people a voice online without an associated identity.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SsShZO&via=Digg&text=The Social Network Where We're All Just A Number

div.a: Lance Armstrong Sued For Lying In His Books

div.div: Two readers of Lance Armstrong's book "It's not about the Bike" have filed a class-action suit against him and his publishers in federal court, claiming the book is a fraud based on lies and false advertising.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10w8e0k&via=Digg&text=Lance Armstrong Sued For Lying In His Books

div.div: YOU TRY SLEEPING IN A CRAMPED CAPSULE

div.a: What A Fake Mars Mission Says About Our Own Sleep Habits

div.div: On November 4, 2011, six men emerged from a windowless capsule based on the site of the Institute of Biomedical Problems in Moscow, Russia. They had been inside their spaceship for 520 days, enough time to (optimistically) go to Mars and back. They carried out the same kinds of activities and experiments that any astronauts would do on such a mission. Except for one thing: they never actually left Earth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XxFVgf&via=Digg&text=What A Fake Mars Mission Says About Our Own Sleep Habits

div.a: Voice Of Charlie Brown Arrested For Stalking

div.div: Peter Robbins, who provided the voice of Charlie Brown on animated specials inspired by the "Peanuts" comic strip, was arrested Sunday on charges of stalking.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XxN2EJ&via=Digg&text=Voice Of Charlie Brown Arrested For Stalking

div.a: When We Blew Up Arizona To Simulate The Moon

div.div: In the late 1960s, NASA created an offworld analogue with dynamite and fertilizer bombs outside Flagstaff, Arizona, so that astronauts could train for the Apollo missions.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10SviMr&via=Digg&text=When We Blew Up Arizona To Simulate The Moon

div.a: Cops Taser Naked Burglar Who Pooped And Masturbated When Homeowner Pulled A Gun

div.div: Honestly, it's all in the headline.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10Sawg4&via=Digg&text=Cops Taser Naked Burglar Who Pooped And Masturbated When Homeowner Pulled A Gun

div.div: BUT WHO'S GOING TO WALK IT?

div.a: Can I Have A Pet Fox?

div.div: How a furry-convention-attending, Midwestern-accented fox owner teamed up with a bizarre Floridian exotic animal importer and a Soviet geneticist to bring pet foxes to your living room.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V7qhYr&via=Digg&text=Can I Have A Pet Fox?

div.div: Here are some screenshots of Apple.com’s former homepages (using the Internet Archive Wayback Machine). With the exception of Apple’s homepage in 1997, it’s pretty remarkable how little the core design has changed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XAA3EJ&via=Digg&text=15 Years Of Apple's Homepage

div.a: The Biggest Bomb In The History Of The World

div.div: Big Ivan, better known as Tsar Bomba, was 57 Megatons of Soviet might. That's 1,400 times Hiroshima and Nagasaki combined and ten times the entire combined fire power expended in WWII. In one bomb. One explosion. And, incredibly, that's only half of what it could have done.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/145n1DD&via=Digg&text=The Biggest Bomb In The History Of The World

div.div: HOW IS LATVIA IN THIS LIST?

div.a: Which Country Has The World's Fastest Internet?

div.div: Where does the U.S. rank on the list of the top 10 countries or regions with the fastest broadband connections? Nowhere.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VTHQOJ&via=Digg&text=Which Country Has The World's Fastest Internet?

div.div: GUESS WHO STILL HAS THE MOST?

div.a: These Are The Last Colonies Left On Earth

div.div: Today the number of entries has dwindled to just 15, most of which are British, or 16 if you include ambiguous Western Sahara.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/10IN0AV&via=Digg&text=These Are The Last Colonies Left On Earth

div.a: Here's What Other People Do In Bed

div.div: A new book takes an in-depth look at relationship sex — who’s doing it, who’s not, where, when, why and how happy it makes them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SBT5LY&via=Digg&text=Here's What Other People Do In Bed

div.a: What Four Years Looks Like In One Picture

div.div: Apparently your 2nd inauguration just isn't that exciting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VQnE03&via=Digg&text=What Four Years Looks Like In One Picture
